author: wsjcom
title: Time to Reconsider Mandatory Arbitration
text:
Filing fees and expenses are major barriers to consumers seeking recourse through arbitration clauses (“Arbitration Inhibits Some Claims,” U.S. News, Jan. 26). A plaintiff can file a lawsuit for a one-time fee of $50. The judge, courtroom and all expenses are paid by the public. Initial arbitration filing fees and final fees begin at $1,550, and for claims seeking higher damages the fees escalate into the thousands. In addition, the parties pay one or more arbitrators per hour plus hotel and travel expenses. Mandatory arbitration discourages many cases from being pursued.
